posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.34 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here . If you’d like to get releases even faster, try out Obtainium!

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

No new notes, but lots of bug fixes!

Complete list of new commits since 7.33.2
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.33.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

Hello! No big features, but this release does try to address some longer-running issues. Two things of note:

  • The “jiggling” messages that sometimes happen when receiving a quoted reply.
  • The app not consistently jumping to the correct unread marker when you open a chat.

Let us know if those things are resolved or still causing issues!

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Obtainium
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.33 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.34.0 (151300)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

32 new commits since 7.33.2:

Show commits

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.4 [1]

  • Update note to self sending flow. [2]

  • Fix note to self sorting by profile name in search bug. [3]

  • Improve unread header counting and positioning. [4]

  • Remove old call participant dialog. [5]

  • Migrate WebRtcCallViewModel to Flow apis. [6]

  • Clean up nullability checks in WebRtcCallActivity. [7]

  • Only write out one MDAT box for a video transcode. [8]

  • Fix libsignal-net crashes around CONNECTING state. [9]

  • Add a thread dump section to the log. [10]

  • Fix about text color. [11]

    Fixes #13789
    Resolves #13979

  • Fix position for archive icon in RTL. [12]

    Resolves #13976

  • Fix multi-select and voice note headers overlapping. [13]

    Resolves #13962

  • Fix a lint issue. [14]

  • Remove okio.withLock import in LibSignalChatConnection. [15]

  • Add fix + regression test for null disconnectReason in onConnectionInterrupted. [16]

  • Convert push unit tests to Kotlin. [17]

    Resolves #13978

  • Do not show backup size for non-media backups. [18]

  • Add CallScreenMediator pattern to facilitate moving from views to compose. [19]

  • Update translation queries. [20]

  • Fix potential build race condition with country code select fragments. [21]

  • Strip spaces from IBAN values before attempting to validate and transform them. [22]

  • Allow searching with + prefix. [23]

  • Add check for authorized job. Fix issue with start external activity error propagation. [24]

  • Update last seen logic to used last read message instead of now timestamp. [25]

  • Update biometrics check when linking. [26]

  • Update to the standard SignalService.proto [27]

  • Bump libsignal to v0.66.1 [28]

  • Fix in-call proximity lock. [29]

  • Adjust how we external nav for ideal donations. [30]

  • Update translations and other static files. [31]

  • Bump version to 7.34.0 [32]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.33.2…v7.34.0

posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:
  • The “jiggling” messages that sometimes happen when receiving a quoted reply.
  • The app not consistently jumping to the correct unread marker when you open a chat.

nice, those are genuine quality of life improvements! will try to be on the lookout.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
GIFs sent by others on both iOS and Android devices are rendering on my phone as videos.

Example message: 1739468237816
Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.34.0/0475646c5159827a3972394298a46d16954e9d1893017198dfe5aa58b4df3b23

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

GIFs sent by others on both iOS and Android devices are rendering on my phone as videos.

Do you know how those people are sending them? Are they using the in-app picker, or something else (like maybe a system keyboard picker or a website)?

New Version: 7.34.1 (151400)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

7 new commits since 7.34.0:

  • Ensure that audio attachments with text aren't exported as voice notes. [1]

  • Improve logging on some backup validation errors. [2]

  • Display thanks sheet if we resume activity before iDEAL is redeemed. [3]

  • Fix issue with exporting invalid e164s. [4]

  • Update translations and other static files. [5]

  • Update baseline profile. [6]

  • Bump version to 7.34.1 [7]

posts.cooked:
Delete chat folder is off-center

The checkbox overlaps Add button when adding contact to notification profile. Only happens if none selected.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: It would help a lot to get debug logs or at least your device info, to know screen resolution, DPI, know whether you are splitting the screen between two apps, using chat bubbles, etc.

GIFs sent by others on both iOS and Android devices are rendering on my phone as videos.

Found the bug, will be fixed in 7.34.2. Thank you for finding it!

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: If I quite reply a sticker on Android, on Desktop it shows up as a quote reply to a placeholder file icon.

Who can find me by number keeps resetting to everybody.

Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.34.2/419b0291e121e79a4370faead9b065ae4a232d8543b393a0a12ecf29e02727f4

I’ve changed it back to nobody twice in the last week. A warning that it has been changed to everybody would be nice. I’m checking the setting on a whim .

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

Who can find me by number keeps resetting to everybody.

Hmm, I’m a bit confused by the log, because we actually do log whenever the find-me-by or discoverability setting is changed, along with a trace of where it was changed from. And it looks like every time it’s changed to EVERYBODY (or NOBODY), it’s been the result of a touch input in the phone number privacy settings screen.

The pattern I see seems to be that the screen opens, about a second later it’s touched and changed to EVERYBODY, and then another second later it’s tapped and changed to NOBODY. That sequence happens twice at two different times (2/20 and 2/17).

Does that resonate with you at all? Do you recall having to tap it twice? Is it possible the setting is rendering incorrectly?

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

If I quite reply a sticker on Android, on Desktop it shows up as a quote reply to a placeholder file icon.

Hmm, I can’t repo on 7.34.2. Does it happen with all stickers, or just some?

That sounds consistent with my own behavior. Every so often I change my discoverability to Everyone so I can find people myself (in case contacts have joined recently), but I change it back to Nobody afterward. The only “tap twice” that happens is choosing “ok” when changing " who can find me by number" to Nobody.

It seems like I’m recognizing a pattern that isn’t happening and it’s just a “me problem” . Sorry for the false alarm. If it happens again in a week, I’ll let you know.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Doesn’t seem to be happening anymore :(
